MY 2026 PICKS ARE IN

When I started the growth portfolio, I didn‚Äôt expect it to double in each of the first three years. 

I make a small set of high conviction picks each year where I focus on early disruptors & reratings the market is overlooking:
2023: $RKLB, $IONQ
2024: $AEHR, $EOSE
2025: $ASTS, $NVTS, $JMIA

The 2026 picks are out. One is around a $400M market cap & the other around $4B. 

Any guesses?

$AMZN is building an $11B data center campus in Indiana dedicated to training and inference at scale.

The site will draw ~2.2 GW of power which is equivalent to powering 1M homes.

$EOSE is my favorite name in this space because it sits at the exact fault line of the AI power problem that almost no one is pricing correctly yet. 

AI data centers create violent load swings that break grids and long-duration storage sits directly at that bottleneck.

$GOOGL controls the full AI stack from models to silicon to distribution which matters in 2026 as AI platform wars shift from model quality to data and distribution advantage.

Please help Geffen Bitton, the Sydney unsung hero ‚Äúin the red T shirt‚Äù who ran to into the line of fire after Ahmed Al Ahmed to fight the terrorist, is in serous condition and needs needs our help. gofundme.com/f/gefen-our-her‚Ä¶

Let us not forget him as his identity was only shared today.

Geffen who moved towards the Bondi gunman instead of fleeing remains fighting for his life after being shot.

Gefen Bitton, 30, referred to as the ‚Äòman in a red T-shirt‚Äô after he was seen in footage from Sunday‚Äôs attack near the footbridge running to help Ahmed Al Ahmed as he disarmed terrorist gunman Sajid Akram

Bitton, an Israeli who has been working in Australia for about three years as a garage door technician, was attending the Chanukah by the Sea event, his friend Tom Cohen told 7NEWS.com.au.

He had been looking forward to watching the ceremonial lighting of the menorah when the shooting began.

As gunfire rang out, another friend of Bitton‚Äôs stood up and ran, but seconds later realised the 30-year-old was not with him.

Moments later his sister in Israel then received a phone call from Bitton saying he had been shot.

She alerted his friends in Sydney, who began desperately searching for him, before eventually finding him at St Vincent‚Äôs Hospital, initially listed as an unidentified patient.

In the days that followed, friends recognised Bitton in footage that showed him attempting to help, but was shot by the terrorist Naveed Akram.

Friends believe Bitton‚Äôs decision to run back toward the bridge also explains why his phone and keys were later found closer to the gunman than where he had been sitting moments earlier.

Another friend, Cayli Barr, said Bitton‚Äôs decision was something ‚Äúmost of us couldn‚Äôt even imagine‚Äù.

‚ÄúGefen had escaped, he was safe, but when he saw the terrorist, he ran into the line of fire to help,‚Äù Barr wrote in a GoFundMe page set up to support Bitton.

‚ÄúHe made the decision to put himself at risk to save the lives of others.

‚ÄúAs Ahmad Al Ahmad heroically jumped on the terrorist, Gefen ran in alongside to confront the terrorist.

‚ÄúThere, he was shot, fell to the ground, and shot again.

‚ÄúNow in the ICU, Gefen‚Äôs put his own life at risk with his selfless actions.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe ran into the face of danger like only a hero does, guided by the values on which he was educated and raised.‚Äù

Bitton‚Äôs father has since flown from overseas to Sydney to be by his son‚Äôs bedside, as friends and family keep vigil at the hospital.
Five days on, he remains in intensive care, unresponsive, and has undergone five surgeries, Cohen said.

He was shot in the lower abdomen near the hip, shattering his pelvic bone.

Bone fragments caused severe internal injuries, and doctors required three to four operations to stop the internal bleeding.
Cohen said it is unclear whether Bitton will regain full use of his leg, and that the road to recovery will be long.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs like the most spiritual guy ever,‚Äù Cohen said, describing Bitton as ‚Äúsuper brave and super unique‚Äù.

‚ÄúHe loves people and always turns words into action.

Triple witching refers to the simultaneous expiration of 3 types of derivative contracts on the same day: Stock index futures
Stock index options
Individual stock options
Only 4 times/year, on the third Friday of March, June, Sept & December.

This list should have sparked a bond rally, but it is not.
When markets cannot rally on good news (falling yields for bonds), it is a signal.
--
* Dec 10 - The Fed cuts 25 bps, bringing the total cuts to 175 bps since September 2024 - BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Dec 10 - During his press conference, Chairman Powell said: ‚ÄúPayroll jobs averaging 40,000 per month since April. We think there‚Äôs an overstatement in ‚Äî in these numbers by about 60,000. So that would be negative 20,000 per month.‚Äù - INCREDIBLY BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Dec 16 - Employment report, October payrolls down 105k, November unemployment 4.6%, a new cyclical high. - BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Dec 18 - CPI missed expectations. Core CPI 2.6%, lowest since 2021 - BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Since Dec 10, the national average for gasoline prices is down 3+% to $2.88, the lowest since mid-2021. - INCREDIBLY BULLISH FOR BONDS

Google Cloud $GOOG and Palo Alto $PANW expanded their security services partnership, with Palo Alto said to be spending nearly $10 billion on Google Cloud over the next several years. 

Palo Alto execs said that a sizable portion of this will go toward new services involving AI.

The WSJ reports that OpenAI's new fundraising round could value the firm at $830 billion, a 66% increase, with an aim of completing the round by Q1 though terms are still subject to change.

WHY TRADERS LOSE THEIR DISCIPLINE.

Jesse Livermore‚Äôs Greatest Comebacks

‚úÖ He accepted total losses without excuses

‚úÖ He stepped away to study his own mistakes

‚úÖ He returned with smaller size and stricter rules

‚úÖ He waited patiently for clear market conditions

‚úÖ He pressed hard only when the trend proved him right

Real example
After being wiped out early in his career, Livermore walked away from the market, rebuilt his rules, and returned trading small.
Years later, during the 1907 Panic, he waited for confirmation of weakness, then sold aggressively after the trend was clear‚Äîearning millions while others were reacting emotionally.

The truth
Livermore didn‚Äôt come back by trading more.
He came back by trading better.

The chart below shows Net Debt/EBITDA for the S&P 500, still near 20-year lows.

EBITDA = Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation & amortization. A key measure of a company‚Äôs operating profitability.

Net Debt/EBITDA tells us how easily companies can repay debt using profits. Lower = stronger financial health.

Despite rate hikes and macro risks, U.S. corporates remain well-positioned, with stronger balance sheets than previous cycles like the Housing or Shale booms.
